comments.body: Great idea! This would make having God armor more satisfying than ever

Or just the color of the glint?
1 enchantment could be purple, and the more enchantment it has, the more Red it gets?
I don't think of the endermen as being "controlled" by the ender dragon.

Only because both Ender-  -man and -dragon both have an "Ender" in them, doesn't tell they're related;

1. Endermen sometimes even attack the Enderdragon

2. The warped forest is also bluish/greenish

3. Looking at the texture of endereyes, you'll see they're green, if you made these purple, it would be a more logic change

4. The Enderdragon can be respawned, and is never really "dead" or "defeated"

5. How should it be done on Multiplayer, which one is the "normal" color? (Someone joins, and endermen's eyes are instantly colored?!

6. I dislike it, and everyone is allowed to have an opinion.... xD

Endermen are not really controlled by the Ender Dragon. They can teleport anywhere. Though the lore suggests that they aren't particularly happy about the existence of the Ender Dragon in the End, or else they wouldn't tell you to "look for the eye". Just my speculation ;)

This is really old but I agree with you, don't know why other people dislike this, I really enjoy defining a Lore in Minecraft, because it's so open that everyone can create his story. Maybe I wouldn't change the color of the eyes even in the nether and in the end but it would be nice if they resumed their green color even if purple is certainly more threatening, but it is precisely because looking into their eyes it's as if I were looking at the enderdragon, that's cool. I had also read another theory according to which with the blaze rod you revived their eyes making them return to their original color.
I love this idea! Its just creative and seems like a lot of fun. If I remember I'll try and make this into a pack over the summer, no promises though ;)
I love the mathiness and detail, but I fear that it wouldn't always match up well with the visual effect of the block breaking as you mine it...
but wouldn't the particles in real life be invisible to the naked eye

@TheIronSniper1 In flower fields in real life, you can see nectar in the air from time to time, and in the desert there's a lot of sand in the air, some bigger clusters being visible(and getting inyour eye). I just think it would add to the environment and aesthetic of the game...
I think it would be a great addition to minecraft
I think the image has it too noticeable, it should probably be closer to the particles in the nether.
I like the idea, especially about the desert. But the particles of grass are superfluous, except that the particles of drops when walking, imitating dew.

People confuse RTX and shaders, RTX is exclusive to NVIDIA graphics card, why? Because it's really demanding, most pc users can't play RTX unless they have a 2000$ GPUs, so for consoles to have RTX is nothing short of a dream.

RTX should be long time ago in Minecraft, I really don't understand why they haven't implemented RTX to Minecraft on Consoles. Xbox Series X and PS5 have such abilities, as many why more demanding titles proved that.
its not possible cause it dosent have a enough good prossesor

Honestly, I will not be happy unless mojang decides to give the community access to shaders. The marketplace is okay, and I'm happy people are making money off of it, but I want to be able to get shaders for free on android and windows 10, just like I used to.

Depending on how this idea is done it could be really good or really bad

but again that depends on how it’s developed.
If this did happen I think it should be gradual
This needs to happen. I haven't been able to play since that update because the game freezes when opened.
I have an RTX but I think old render engine was better
i LOVE this idea
Even Just Little Things, Breathing, Blinking ect., Would Be Great
Something like a cobblestone fence on a cobblestone block would look sick!

Although I agree, I don't know how you'd improve it... 3D stalactites are weird in the same way mods that give trees thin, square branches are weird. It messes with the uniform size of most natural blocks.

You could design them similar to trees, with a full-block "trunk" ending in some sort of special point, but that may look equally strange...

It's tricky!
Totally agree. I think the base should be pretty much stone and then it'd fade to a brighter and more faded texture. That way they can be seen, and look more natural.

I think it could look good to make them like cobblestonewalls
the point would then in principle be one (or more) thinner cobblestonewall
Yeah the way the light reacted to them was kind of weird

They decided to use the same technique that they used for grass to optimize the game, using a 3D model would mean more polygons and more lag, the current stalactites and stalagmites look very nice and they look very sharp, if they would have used 3D models, the stalactites and stalagmites wouldn't look as sharp and deadly as they look right now.
stalagmite/stalactites appear in many mods as 3D models. with such good examples i don't understand why the game would add such an inferior looking 2D version.
Thats a great idea
Minecraft has a simple art style, this would not fit at all

Good idea   /-------\   

                   | o    o |

                   |  -----  |

                   \_____/
Sounds pretty hard to code in, but sounds neat.
Very nice!

It should have the purple incide replaced with an eye of ender

It should also have enchantment particles

Something 4k HDR games do is calibrate your game with sliders for highs, mids & low

https://www.bungie.net/pubassets/pkgs/156/156116/HDR_Settings.jpg?cv=3983621215&av=2259311299
Agreed. though I don't like the Wild update very much, I think your idea would help me look at it in a nice way!
They wont add shadows because that would require shaders and shaders lag the game and do not work for many devices and only works for computers with rtx you can download shaders anyway

Maybe they could make only shadows look better, not everything, i don’t think it would be a drastic change to performance that much, good example is the entity shadow, they don’t change performance much i think, and they can be toggled off as the player wishes.
It becomes very beautiful To be honest, I ask the developers to select this feature and put it in the options setting video Thanks.
Shadow real nice

In PS4 I haven't mode or shader, and I think It Will be a great idea. If the game Is slowly, I think Mojang can create a button and, before you create the world, if Is on, there are Better Shadows, else the are like in normale game. Thanks Mojang! I love Your game! ;)

Hi, I think warden has better animations than other mobs, I know it takes time, but you can update more animations for mobs.

Now, if this is the first time a Minecraft player has played, they will quickly realize that 《warden》 is newer than the others.

But this is not the case with the new animations
this need to be added,new mobs like camel and sniffer has a good animation such as when they wallking they legs got lifted
older mobs need better animations

This defeats the purpose of a texture pack, in vanilla using no mods one can use custom_model_data to assign a custom texture through a command given item, sadly the predicate "custom_item_name" does not function with this system making it impossible in vanilla to get a custom texture without the usage of commands (unless you count durability or some other things), on top of that, I'm still unsure of what your asking as being able to retexture items without a resource or mod would be extremely difficult server and client side as you would need a sprite to correspond with that new item texture and you cannot simply expect Mojang to make multiple different sprites for one item.
It should be for all entities and mobs like how wolves turn darker and drop water when exiting water and rain.
This would be extremely good for all platforms, a new option could be added to the settings, so players could choose whether to add shadows or not.

This would be an amazing atmospheric change. I believe the developers keep adding a lot of things without improving what they already have. Adding light-dependant shadows would make the game feel so much more alive and can really enhance the game experience.
I like this idea
I would like to extend this idea to music discs as well. Why limit artistic capability to just the realm of the optical? Aural art contests should happen too.
Thanks for voting for my idea! This was my first post on the Feedback website.

technically it wasn't removed, there was a bug in the server code that prevented it from working, and in 1.3.1 single-player worlds switched to running internal server code, there by stopping it from working all together
I agree, I also find that the shield animations in third person should follow the animations found in first person as it looks rather odd as it is.
really good idea. Especially with how other things like the sword and axe all have animations where they slowly go up, the shield should be the exact same.

Thanks so much for this. Cleary some troll as Mojang added this to prank and irritate players. It was funny when 1.9 first came out, but still hasn't been removed to this day.......... ): I will say though that just making the blocking instant would work well to. But having an invisible delay seems buggy and unpolished.

The amount of dumb deaths I've had to skeletons and endermen because the shield animations doesn't match the delay has made me hate this feature. It's such an easy fix that it's insulting that it hasn't been already.
This would be very helpful for map makers and banners, however their should be a gamerule /doMapImageTransparency
